item.description:
Join us for an evening lecture with author Carolyn Baker as she returns to Maine for the first time in three years.   Carolyn continues to be one of the trailblazers in forthrightly addressing the personal "inner" dimensions of the challenging and volatile world circumstances in which we find ourselves. In this lecture, Carolyn will introduce the key concepts and developments in the work of Inner Transition, especially as they relate to climate disruption, energy uncertainty and economic volatility.

NOTE:  Attendees may also wish to attend a half-day small group workshop with Carolyn the following morning in order to go deeper into the work of personal resilience-building.

Co-sponsored by the First Parish in Portland Maine, Unitarian Universalist

7:00 Doors Open / Carolyn Meet-and-Greet / Light Refreshments

7:15 Announcements + Lecture

8:15 Discussion + Questions

8:30 Wrap-up

---------------------

More About Carolyn


CAROLYN BAKER, Ph.D., was an adjunct professor of history and psychology for 11 years and a psychotherapist in private practice for 17 years.

Her previous book Sacred Demise: Walking The Spiritual Path of Industrial Civilization’s Collapse, is unique in its offering of emotional and spiritual tools for preparing for living in a post-industrial world. Carolyn’s current book is Navigating The Coming Chaos: A Handbook For Inner Transition. Her other books include:Coming Out From Christian Fundamentalism: Affirming Sensuality, Social Justice, and The Sacred (2007) , U.S. History Uncensored: What Your High School Textbook Didn’t Tell You(2006) and The Journey of Forgiveness, (2000)

group.name: Portland Maine Permaculture & The Resilience Hub

item.name: Evening Lecture w/Author Carolyn Baker: Navigating the Coming Chaos
